title: Pittsburgh boy, 10, needs second liver transplant to save his life: ‘Only possible through love’
author: None
fact: Lucas Goeller, now 10, was born with a rare, life-threatening condition called biliary atresia, which is a blockage that prevents bile from traveling from the liver to the gallbladder. He spent 18 months on the liver transplant list, getting sicker each week, and did not receive a single organ donation offer. A Facebook page led to a viral national campaign that attracted the attention of a Nebraska family.

title: The best Prime Day deals on headphones for October 2023
author: Jeff Dunn
fact: Amazon is offering discounts on headphones, earbuds and gaming headsets. AirPods Pro, Sony WF-1000XM5, Beats Studio Pro, Amazon Echo Buds and more are all on sale. Some, but not all, of the offers are only accessible if you subscribe to Prime.

title: Israeli girl spends 9th birthday in 'tunnels of Gaza,' with 'no friends, 'no light,' says distraught father
author: None
fact: Emily Hand's birthday will be marked here in America with billboards that go on display in Times Square and Madison Square Garden in Manhattan. Billboards with images of Israelis held hostage in Gaza will also appear in 1,500 other locations in 48 cities across the United States.

title: The best comedies you’ll find on streaming right now
author: Toussaint Egan
fact: Hollywood has been in a comedic rut in recent years, with fewer and fewer notable releases from big studios. But fear not, dear reader — we know how to find some good laughs. We’ve compiled a list of the best comedy movies you can watch at home.

title: Palestine’s growing tech industry has been literally blown apart by Israel’s war on Hamas
author: Mike Butcher
fact: Gaza has always been a tech hub for Palestine and the world. Silicon Valley had taken an increasing interest in Palestine as a techhub. The impact on the smaller and more fragile ecosystem in Gaza is significantly more serious.

title: Consistent policy is key to unlocking the climate tech boom, but the UK’s U-turn isn’t helping
author: Carrie Andrews
fact: British PM Rishi Sunak has pushed back the British net-zero transition timeline by at least five years. The U.K. government isn’t willing to be consistent when it comes to climate crisis response policy. All major technological innovation ultimately comes from government support at the very beginning.

title: 41 Best Prime Day Apple Deals (2023)
author: Brenda Stolyar
fact: Amazon is offering a variety of Apple deals on Prime Day. The deals include iPads, Apple Watches, iPhone cases, and MagSafe accessories. These deals aren't just at Amazon either—we've linked to other retailers like Best Buy.

title: NTPC: Why investors can accumulate this stock
author: None
fact: The Power Ministry has scheduled tenders of around 50 GW annually of renewable energy for the next five years. NTPC earns majority of revenue from sale of power generated from thermal-based generating stations. More than 90 per cent of its revenue is tied to long-term power purchase agreement.

title: The world came tantalizingly close to a deal to phase out fossil fuels
author: Justine Calma
fact: More than 100 countries came to the table pushing for an official agreement to “phase out fossil fuels.” The final text calls for “accelerating efforts towards the phase-down of unabated coal power’ The UN’s decision to hold the summit in the United Arab Emirates, a major oil and gas producer, gave the fossil fuel industry unprecedented access.

title: Daye now offers tampon-based STI screening — starting in the UK
author: Natasha Lomas
fact: U.K. femcare-turned-gynaecological-health startup, Daye, has expanded its tampon-based home screening service to add STI testing. The “STI Diagnostic Tampon’ service uses Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) testing tech to detect the presence of pathogens. Daye is launching with the ability to test for five STIs.

title: Cannabis use in pregnancy linked to small birth size, other poor outcomes
author: None
source: Live Science: The Most Interesting Articles
fact: Using cannabis during pregnancy may come with a higher risk of poor outcomes. Among pregnant people who use cannabis, the risks are the highest for those who use the drug in both the first trimester and later in gestation. The study doesn't directly demonstrate that cannabis causes these effects. But it does suggest that cannabis use should be avoided during pregnancy.

title: Walks, tech and protein: how to parent your own parents
author: Annabel Streets
fact: Parenting no longer starts and stops with our children. Nor is it confined to those who have children. In a time of unrelenting change and ever-extending life, most of us will – at some stage – find ourselves ‘parenting’ our own parents.

title: super Mario Bros. Wonder is a perfect end for the Switch
author: Chris Plante
fact: super Mario Bros. Wonder is a loyal continuation of the plumber’s work in the 2D platformer genre. A new badge system allows players to select from a growing collection of special abilities. The traditional and the topsy-turvy coexist.

title: The best apps and tools for managing your money online
author: David Pierce
fact: This week, we look at the best tools for managing money. We also look at new gadgets from Valve and Humane. And there are way too many writing apps, new stuff from ChatGPT.

title: Meta to offer ad-free subscription in Europe in bid to keep tracking other users
author: Natasha Lomas
fact: Adtech giant Meta is to offer an ad-free subscription version of Facebook and Instagram in the European Union, EEA (European Economic Area) and Switzerland. The move follows years of privacy litigation, enforcements and court rulings in the EU.
